courses.name: Group Piano for Music Majors I
courses.description: Beginning piano for music majors and concentrations only.

courses.name: Group Piano for Music Majors II
courses.description: Continuation of MUS_I_VT 1610.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_I_VT 1610 with a minimum grade of C- or instructor's consent

courses.name: Jazz Piano Class
courses.description: Beginning piano technique and study of common jazz piano voicings for accompaniment and solo performance.
courses.prerequisites: MUSIC_NM 1211 or MUS_THRY 1220; instructor's consent required

courses.name: Group Piano for Music Majors III
courses.description: Continuation of MUS_I_VT 1611.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_I_VT 1611 with a minimum grade of C- or instructor's consent

courses.name: Group Piano for Music Majors IV
courses.description: Continuation of MUS_I_VT 2610.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_I_VT 2610 with a minimum grade of C- or instructor's consent

courses.name: Basic Conducting and Score Reading
courses.description: To develop the basic psychomotor and score reading skills prerequisite to the art of conducting.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 2220

courses.name: Rehearsal Clinic: String Orchestra Conducting
courses.description: To develop musical and interpersonal skills requisite for successful rehearsal leadership, emphasizing strategies effective for rehearsal of string ensembles.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_I_VT 2631 and either MUS_I_VT 2640 or MUS_I_VT 2641

courses.name: Rehearsal Clinic: Choral Conducting I
courses.description: To develop musical and interpersonal skills requisite for successful leadership of a choral ensemble, emphasizing rehearsal strategies and repertoire.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_I_VT 2631 or instructor's consent

courses.name: Rehearsal Clinic: Band Conducting I
courses.description: To develop musical and interpersonal skills requisite for successful rehearsal leadership, emphasizing strategies effective for rehearsal of wind and percussion ensembles.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_I_VT 2631 or instructor's consent

courses.name: Rehearsal Clinic: Choral Conducting II
courses.description: Continuation of MUS_I_VT 2633.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_I_VT 2633

courses.name: Rehearsal Clinic: Band Conducting II
courses.description: Continuation of MUS_I_VT 2634.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_I_VT 2634

courses.name: Woodwinds I
courses.description: Class instruction in clarinet and saxophone; playing and methods/materials for teaching. Taught on a laboratory basis. Meets twice weekly.
courses.prerequisites: major in Music or Music Education

courses.name: Woodwinds II
courses.description: Class instruction in flute and double reeds; playing and methods/materials for teaching. Taught on a laboratory basis. Meets twice weekly.
courses.prerequisites: major in Music or Music Education

courses.name: Strings I
courses.description: Class instruction in violin and viola; playing and methods and materials for teaching. Taught on a laboratory basis. Meets twice weekly.
courses.prerequisites: major in Music or Music Education

courses.name: Strings II
courses.description: Class instruction in violoncello and string bass; playing and methods and materials for teaching. Taught on a laboratory basis. Meets twice weekly.
courses.prerequisites: major in Music or Music Education

courses.name: Brass I
courses.description: Class instruction in trumpet and horn; playing and methods/ materials for teaching. Taught on a laboratory basis. Meets twice weekly.
courses.prerequisites: major in Music or Music Education

courses.name: Brass II
courses.description: Class instruction in trombone, euphonium, and tuba; playing and methods/materials for teaching. Taught on a laboratory basis. Meets twice weekly.
courses.prerequisites: major in Music or Music Education

courses.name: Percussion
courses.description: Class instruction in percussion instruments; playing and methods and materials for teaching. Taught on a laboratory basis. Meets twice weekly.

courses.name: Percussion II
courses.description: Extension of MUS_I_VT 2648.  Topics include marching percussion, drumset, Latin accessory instruments, and percussion ensemble literature.

courses.name: Keyboard Skills for Piano Majors I
courses.description: Study of sightreading, harmonization, transposition, figured bass realization, and duet skills.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in MUS_THRY 1221 and MUS_THRY 1231; instructor's consent

courses.name: Keyboard Skills for Piano Majors II
courses.description: Study of score reading, duet performance, and collaborative experiences with voice and instruments.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C- or better in MUS_I_VT 2661; instructor's consent

courses.name: Undergraduate Seminar in Vocal Techniques
courses.description: Discusses accepted techniques of singing, practical application to posture, breath support, tone placement, musicianship, diction, interpretation, stage deportment. Recognizing and solving specific vocal problems. May be repeated once for credit.

courses.name: Seminar in String Techniques
courses.description: In-depth study of publications, philosophies, repertory, grading, specific problems for the string player. May be repeated once for credit.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_I_VT 2640 and MUS_I_VT 2641, or instructor's consent

courses.name: Symposium in Instrumental Music
courses.description: Study of procedures, techniques and literature for variable combinations of wind, string, and percussion classes and the administration of instrumental music programs.
courses.prerequisites: junior standing in Music or Music Education or instructor's consent

courses.name: Jazz Methods and Materials
courses.description: Training and supervised practice in conducting Jazz Ensembles; study of administration, methods, and materials pertinent to teaching Jazz, Rock, and Commercial Music in high school and college.

courses.name: Marching Band Techniques
courses.description: Study of techniques and procedures used in the development of field and street marching.
courses.prerequisites: junior standing in Music or Music Education

courses.name: Diction in Singing: Italian
courses.description: Study of the correct principles and application of Italian diction in singing the solo vocal, operatic and choral literature; the International phonetic alphabet; spoken language drill, study and recitation of representative literature.

courses.name: Diction in Singing: German
courses.description: Study of the correct principles and application of German diction in singing the solo vocal, operatic and choral literature; the International Phonetic Alphabet spoken language drill, study and recitation of representative literature.

courses.name: Diction in Singing: French
courses.description: Study of the correct principles and application of French diction in singing the solo vocal, operatic, and choral literature; the International Phonetic Alphabet spoken language drill, study and recitation of representative literature.

courses.name: Diction in Singing: English
courses.description: Study of the correct principles and application of English diction in singing the solo vocal, operatic and choral literature; the International phonetic alphabet; spoken language drill, study and recitation of representative literature.

courses.name: Introduction to Improvisation
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_I_VT 7640). Introduction to contemporary improvisation, aimed at classically trained musicians. No improvisational experience necessary.

courses.name: Jazz Improvisation
courses.description: Creation of a melodic vocabulary for jazz improvisation through study and application of jazz chord-scale theory, solo transcription, and careful listening to the vanguard of jazz.

courses.name: Piano Pedagogy Survey I
courses.description: Study of approaches for teaching young beginning and intermediate student; survey of materials and resources.

courses.name: Piano Pedagogy Survey II
courses.description: Study of approaches for teaching older, more advanced and class piano students; survey of materials and resources.

courses.name: Piano Pedagogy Laboratory
courses.description: Supervised instruction in private and class piano . May be repeated once for additional credit.

courses.name: Classical Guitar Pedagogy
courses.description: Basic anatomical and physiological aspects of guitar performance, setting technical and musical goals for students, repertoire development in relation to age, level, and musical style.  Career goals (building a private studio, lesson planning, organizational skills) are addressed.

courses.name: Introduction to Improvisation
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_I_VT 4640). Introduction to contemporary improvisation, aimed at classically trained musicians. No improvisational experience necessary.

courses.name: Graduate Jazz Improvisation
courses.description: Creation of a melodic vocabulary for jazz improvisation through study and application of jazz chord-scale theory, solo transcription, and careful listening to the vanguard of jazz.

courses.name: Graduate Classical Guitar Pedagogy
courses.description: Basic anatomical and physiological aspects of guitar performance, setting technical and musical goals for students, repertoire development in relation to age, level and musical style. Career goals (building a private studio, lesson planning, organizational skills) are addressed.

courses.name: Jazz Pedagogy I
courses.description: Study of historical and current trends in jazz education and pedagogy, including administration and curriculum, through assigned readings, supervised teaching, classroom discussion, survey of materials, and formation of an annotated bibliography. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Jazz Pedagogy II
courses.description: Continuation of MUS_I_VT 8646; formulation of an extensive philosophy of jazz education. Graded on A-F basis only.

courses.name: Advanced Choral Conducting
courses.description: Advanced conducting techniques in the interpretation of choral literature; score analysis. May be repeated for additional credit.

courses.name: Advanced Instrumental Conducting
courses.description: Advanced conducting techniques in the interpretation of band and orchestral literature; score analysis. May be repeated for additional credit.

courses.name: Advanced Piano Pedagogy I
courses.description: A survey of materials and techniques of instruction for teaching the young beginner and the intermediate piano student.

courses.name: Advanced Piano Pedagogy II
courses.description: A survey of materials and techniques of instruction for teaching class piano, the older beginner, and the advanced student.

courses.name: Piano Pedagogy Internship
courses.description: Supervised teaching of individual and group lessons. May be repeated once for credit.
courses.prerequisites: MUS_I_VT 8681 and MUS_I_VT 8682 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Group Piano Pedagogy
courses.description: Preparation of graduate students to teach group piano to both college level music majors and adult beginners.

courses.name: Choral Techniques
courses.description: Study of techniques for developing choral singing and musical interpretation.

courses.name: Band Techniques
courses.description: To develop individual conducting techniques as well as instrumental ensemble techniques. Emphasis is placed on the learning process to give the student a perspective to improve the techniques of others.
